metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3137 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Bottle 0.10.x before 0.10.12, 0.11.x before 0.11.7, and 0.12.x before 0.12.6 does not properly limit content types, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via an accepted Content-Type followed by a ; (semi-colon) and a Content-Type that would not be accepted, as demonstrated in YouCompleteMe to execute arbitrary code. It was discovered that Bottle does not properly limit content types. A remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-3137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-bottle - 0.12.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-bottle package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.12.6-1').
